channel.title: Mediagazer
channel.description: Top news and commentary for media professionals from all around the web

item.title: MTVがSnapchatと提携、VMAの最優秀新人アーティスト部門にレンズを通して投票できるように（Ivan Mehta/TechCrunch）
item.description:
Ivan Mehta / TechCrunch:
MTV partners with Snapchat to let users vote for the VMA's Best New Artist category through Lenses  —  MTV has partnered with Snapchat to let users vote for a Video Music Awards category through Lenses.  The entertainment company is leveraging Snap's Camera Kit to integrate AR-based experiences into the award show.

item.title: Skyが20年で権利を放棄した後、ITVがディズニーとの複数年契約で2024年から英国でアカデミー賞を放映する権利を獲得（Alex Ritman/The Hollywood Reporter）
item.description:
Alex Ritman / The Hollywood Reporter:
ITV wins the rights to show the Oscars in the UK starting in 2024 in a multi-year deal with Disney, after Sky gave up the rights after 20 years  —  Sky has ended its 20-year run as the home of the Academy Awards.  —  The Academy Awards has a brand new home in the U.K.

item.title: オンラインクリエイターにとってかつてない好機となった理由：年収100万ドルを稼ぐのはかつてなく難しいかもしれないが、5万ドルを稼ぐのはかつてなく簡単だ（Hunter Walk）
item.description:
Hunter Walk:
Why there has never been a better time to be an online creator: it might be harder than ever to earn $1M per year, but it has never been easier to make $50K  —  I judge the health of the creator economy by one single controversial factor: ease of access and probability of survival for its participants.

item.title: プロのアーティストにより多くの印税を与えるUMGのDeezerとの契約は、他のメジャーレーベルやプラットフォームをストリーミングの新局面に引きずり込む可能性がある（Anna Nicolaou/Financial Times）。
item.description:
Anna Nicolaou / Financial Times:
How UMG's Deezer deal, which will give more royalty money to professional artists, could pull other major labels and platforms into a new phase of streaming  —  Universal's new deal on streaming royalties underscores how the major labels have remade themselves throughout the digital era

item.title: インターネット・アーカイブは、同NPOの電子書籍貸出プログラムをめぐる著作権侵害訴訟で、2023年3月に米判事が下した出版社に有利な判決を不服として控訴する（Andrew Albanese/Publishers Weekly）。
item.description:
Andrew Albanese / Publishers Weekly:
The Internet Archive appeals a US judge's decision in March 2023 favoring publishers in a copyright infringement case over the nonprofit's ebook lending program  —  As expected, the Internet Archive this week submitted its appeal in Hachette v. Internet Archive, the closely-watched copyright case involving …

item.title: 2023年1月、フィリピンの裁判所は、ノーベル賞受賞者でラップラー社CEOのマリア・レッサとアウトレットの脱税容疑について、租税裁判所から無罪を言い渡された（Jairo Bolledo/Rappler）
item.description:
Jairo Bolledo / Rappler:
A Philippine trial court acquits Nobel laureate and Rappler CEO Maria Ressa and the outlet of tax evasion charges after a tax court cleared them in January 2023  —  MANILA, Philippines - A Pasig court acquitted Nobel Peace Prize laureate and Rappler chief executive officer Maria Ressa …

item.title: 情報筋NBCUがローン・マイケルズ、ドウェイン・ジョンソンら脚本家以外のプロデューサーとの契約を停止、CBSスタジオがフィル・マッグローらとの契約を停止（Nellie Andreeva/Deadline）
item.description:
Nellie Andreeva / Deadline:
Sources: NBCU suspends deals with non-writing producers, including Lorne Michaels and Dwayne Johnson, and CBS Studios suspends deals with Phil McGraw and others  —  Co-Editor-in-Chief, TV  — ‘Archer’ Final Season Disrupted As Disney-Charter Deal Also Impacts Linear Viewing For 'It's Always Sunny,' ‘Grown-ish’ & ‘Bluey’

item.title: 英国の『リーチ』は、広告への依存から脱却するため、従量制ペイウォールのアプリを含む読者収入の試みをどのように拡大しているのか（Charlotte Tobitt/Press Gazette）
item.description:
Charlotte Tobitt / Press Gazette:
How the UK's Reach is expanding its reader revenue trials, including apps with metered paywalls, to diversify away from its heavy reliance on ads  —  Reach is diversifying away from ad revenue, although that will remain the main focus.  —  Reach has expanded its experiments with reader revenue …

item.title: フォックス・ニュースのゴールデンタイムのプラットフォームを奪われたタッカー・カールソンは、Xにさらに陰謀論を押し付けるようになり、いかに存在感が薄れ、より過激になったか（Adam Gabbatt/The Guardian）
item.description:
Adam Gabbatt / The Guardian:
How Tucker Carlson, deprived of the prime-time platform of Fox News, has grown less relevant and more extreme, as he pushes even more conspiracy theories on X  —  Carlson, once seen as a Republican powerbroker and even a presidential candidate, has grown more extreme and less relevant

item.title: 調査により、Barstool Sportsが40以上の "バーナー "Xアカウントを管理し、著作権保護された動画を合法的なアカウントにロンダリングしていることが判明した（Robert Silverman/The Daily Beast）。
item.description:
Robert Silverman / The Daily Beast:
An investigation finds that Barstool Sports apparently controls 40+ “burner” X accounts to launder viral copyright-protected videos for its legitimate accounts  —  A Daily Beast investigation found more than forty content-swiping Twitter accounts apparently controlled by Barstool …

item.title: ディズニー・エンターテインメントの共同会長ダナ・ウォルデンとESPNのジミー・ピターロ会長にCharterとの契約、SpectrumによるESPN+のリーチ拡大などについてインタビュー（Alex Weprin/The Hollywood Reporter）
item.description:
Alex Weprin / The Hollywood Reporter:
Interviews with Disney Entertainment co-chairman Dana Walden and ESPN chairman Jimmy Pitaro about the Charter deal, how Spectrum expands ESPN+'s reach, and more  —  Walden, the co-chairman of Disney Entertainment, and Pitaro, the chairman of ESPN, talk about what the Spectrum deal means for their Disney divisions.

item.title: フロリダ大学をカバーする学生新聞『インディペンデント・フロリダ・アリゲーター』は、フロリダ州法を恐れ、中絶薬入手を促進する広告を拒否した（Corbin Bolies/The Daily Beast）。
item.description:
Corbin Bolies / The Daily Beast:
The Independent Florida Alligator, a student newspaper covering the University of Florida, rejected an ad promoting abortion pill access, fearing a Florida law  —  An anti-abortion law made Florida's largest college paper go independent 50 years ago.  And now that law is back to haunt the paper with serious free-speech restrictions.

item.title: 9月8日、ジョー・バイデンがナレンドラ・モディと会談した際、インドは極めて異例なことに、独立ジャーナリストを一切取材させなかった（NBCニュース）。
item.description:
NBC News:
In an extremely rare departure from the usual protocol, India did not let any independent journalist cover Joe Biden's meeting with Narendra Modi on September 8  —  In a rare departure from the usual protocol, not a single independent journalist was allowed to cover Biden's meeting …

item.title: Spectrumは、Charterの新しいディズニー契約の一部として、Freeform、Disney Junior、Disney XD、FXX、Nat Geo Wildといったディズニー所有のいくつかのチャンネルの放送を終了する（Alex Weprin/Hollywood Reporter）。
item.description:
Alex Weprin / Hollywood Reporter:
Spectrum will no longer carry some Disney-owned channels, like Freeform, Disney Junior, Disney XD, FXX, and Nat Geo Wild, as part of Charter's new Disney deal  —  Disney's channels had been blocked for Spectrum customers since Aug. 31, and will return just in time for ‘Monday Night Football’

item.title: ディズニーとCharterの契約は、ESPN+をSpectrum TV Select Plusにバンドルし、ESPNストリーミング・チャンネルとDisney+の広告層をSpectrum TV Selectにバンドルする（Emma Roth/The Verge）
item.description:
Emma Roth / The Verge:
Disney and Charter's deal bundles ESPN+ with Spectrum TV Select Plus, and the upcoming ESPN streaming channel and Disney+'s ad tier with Spectrum TV Select  —  Disney and Charter have resolved the carriage dispute that blocked millions of viewers from watching ESPN, ABC, FX, and other Disney-owned networks.
